crimeSpy.crimeData

Class SQLiteDBHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • crimeSpy.crimeData.SQLiteDBHandler

  • public class SQLiteDBHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to manage interactions between the crimeSpy system and the SQLite Database. CollectionManager will use this to open/save/edit crime data to persistent storage. Relies on: sqllite-jdbc.3.8.11.1.jar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Method Detail

      • writeCrimeRecord

        public static int writeCrimeRecord(CrimeRecord crime)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Write a single block of crime record data to persistent storage. This method expects a CrimeRecord object.
        Parameters:
        crime - is a CrimeCollection object
        Returns:
        exitCode of 0 indicates that there was an error writing to the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - crime record is not able to be written to the db

      • writeCrimeRecords

        public static int writeCrimeRecords(CrimeCollection crimes)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Write a collection of crime data to persistent storage. This method expects a CrimeCollection (collection object of CrimeRecords)
        Parameters:
        crimes - is a CrimeCollection object
        Returns:
        exitCode of 0 indicates that the write failed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - crime collection is not able to be written to the db

        public static void writeNewCrimeCollection(CrimeCollection crimes)

        Parameters:
        crimes - A crime collection object
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        public static CrimeCollection readCrimeRecords()
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - could not read from database

      • readCrimeRecord

        public static CrimeRecord readCrimeRecord(java.lang.String crimeID)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Read a single crime record from persistent storage and return an equivalent CrimeRecord object
        Parameters:
        crimeID - A CrimeRecord ID
        Returns:
        a CrimeRecord object
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - unable to read the crime record from the database

                             throws java.sql.SQLException

      • createNewCrimeTable

        public static void createNewCrimeTable()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        creates the database structure, including all the tables inside the database. CRIME_TYPE table, CRIME_RECORD table
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - tables could not be added

      • populateIUCR

        public static void populateIUCR()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Quick method to populate the crime record database with IUCR codes from a csv file stored in the working directory
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - could not populate the IUCR codes

      • getCrimeTypeData

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCrimeTypeData(java.lang.String iucr)
        Gets the CrimeType data from the CrimeType hashmap, and populates that HashMap if that hasn't been done already
        Parameters:
        iucr - The IUCR for which to retrieve the primary and secondary descriptions
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of length 2 containing a primary and secondary description
